section.heading: Waiver or reduction of permit fees for the occupation of public space, public rights of way, and public structures.

para.text: The Mayor may waive or reduce any liability insurance requirement or permit, custodial, and security fee, except for the application fee, to occupy or otherwise use public space, public rights of way, or public structures for a project that:

Is conducted by a civic association, Advisory Neighborhood Commission, or a Business Improvement District or Community Improvement District established pursuant to subchapter VIII of Chapter 12 of Title 2 [§ 2-1215.01 et seq.];
In the Mayor’s determination, serves a public benefit;
Does not impose costs on the District government, except for the costs of custodial and security services; and
For the purposes of this section, the term "civic association" means an organization that is:
Comprised of residents of the community within which the public space, public right of way, or public structure is located;
Operated primarily for the improvement of the community within which the public space, public right of way, or public structure is located; and
Exempt from taxation under section 501(c)(3) or (4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954, approved August 16, 1954 (68A Stat. 163; 26 U.S.C. § 501(c)(3), (4)); or
A member of the D.C. Federation of Civic Associations or the Federation of Citizens Associations of the District of Columbia.

Beginning November 30, 2019, the Mayor shall report annually to the Council regarding the waiver of fees pursuant to Subtitle P of Title I of D.C. Law 22-33, and shall include the following information in the report:
The total amount of fees waived;
The amount of fees waived broken out by liability insurance, permit fees, custodial fees, and security fees; and
The types and number of organizations for which the fees were waived.
